colors.name: color-text
colors.description: Default text color. Used as the main text color throughout the UI. Provides good and legible contrast for our content.

colors.name: color-text-link
colors.description: Default link text color. Used for all paragraph level links in an user interface.

colors.name: color-text-weak
colors.description: Weak text color. Used for e.g. introduction paragraphs and help texts that are coupled with form elements.

colors.name: color-text-weaker
colors.description: Weaker text color. Used for e.g. disabled buttons, footers, table headings, captions and placeholder texts.

colors.name: color-text-weakest
colors.description: Weakest text color. Used for e.g. disabled input text and placeholder text in focused inputs.

colors.name: color-text-on-accent
colors.description: Default text on accent color. Used when text sits on the acccent color or a dark background.

colors.name: color-text-danger
colors.description: Default text color for danger messages. Also used for the danger badge text.

colors.name: color-text-success
colors.description: Default text color for success messages. Also used for the success badge text.

colors.name: color-text-neutral
colors.description: Neutral text color. Used for the neutral badge text.

colors.name: color-text-info
colors.description: Info text color. Used for the info badge text.

colors.name: color-text-warning
colors.description: Warning text color. Used for the warning badge text.

colors.name: color-accent
colors.description: Accent color. Used as primary button background, hero area background, and as a link color. This color provides accessible contrast when used for text on light background.

colors.name: color-background
colors.description: Default application background color. Should be set to either html or body element.

colors.name: color-surface
colors.description: Default application surface color. Use this for e.g. card backgrounds.

colors.name: color-surface-raised
colors.description: Default raised surface color. Use this when you need to separate a specific layer from the surface color, e.g. table headers.

colors.name: color-surface-lowered
colors.description: Default lowered surface color. Use this when you need to make a specific layer to appear lower than the surface color, e.g. progress bar.

colors.name: color-border
colors.description: Default border color

colors.name: color-border-strong
colors.description: Strong border color for highlighting specific parts in the user interface.

colors.name: color-border-hover
colors.description: Default border hover color.

colors.name: color-border-danger
colors.description: Danger border color. Used for the danger badge border style.

colors.name: color-border-success
colors.description: Success border color. Used for the success badge border style.

colors.name: color-border-neutral
colors.description: Neutral border color. Used for the neutral badge border style.

colors.name: color-border-info
colors.description: Info border color. Used for the info badge border style.

colors.name: color-border-warning
colors.description: Warning border color. Used for the warning badge border style.

colors.name: color-status-danger
colors.description: Default danger status color. Used to communicate problems that have to be resolved so that user can continue forward. This color should be always used for e.g. highlighting errors.

colors.name: color-status-success
colors.description: Default success status color. Used to convey success states. For example, you might show a success message that tells the user that changes were saved or something was completed.

colors.name: color-status-neutral
colors.description: Default neutral status color.

colors.name: color-status-info
colors.description: Default info status color. Used to convey something informal.

colors.name: color-status-warning
colors.description: Default warning status color. Used to display information that needs user's attention and may require further steps.

colors.name: color-status-danger-weak
colors.description: Weak danger status color. Used to communicate problems that have to be resolved so that user can continue forward. This color should be always used for e.g. highlighting errors.

colors.name: color-status-success-weak
colors.description: Weak success status color. Used to convey success states. For example, you might show a success message that tells the user that changes were saved or something was completed.

colors.name: color-status-neutral-weak
colors.description: Weak neutral status color. Used for the badge default state.

colors.name: color-status-info-weak
colors.description: Weak info status color. Used to convey something informal.

colors.name: color-status-warning-weak
colors.description: Weak warning status color. Used to display information that needs a user's attention and may require further steps.

colors.name: color-button-hover
colors.description: Default button hover background color.

colors.name: color-icon
colors.description: Default icon color

colors.name: color-icon-hover
colors.description: Default icon hover color
